column4: someone can help me detecting who is transfering in my wifi? I suspect a neightbour or someone is using it
i did nmap, with this answer: 256 IP addresses (0 hosts up) scanned in 103.17 seconds
ok
anyway, I would like to investigate if someone is really using my wifi
you can look at who is assigned ips on most router pages
most routers default to username: admin  and password: admin
perhaps the ip is not 192.168.1.1
might be that. But then, what is it?
are you runnign linux rightnow?
if so type ifconfig in a terminal and it will show what IP is assigned to your current machine.
yes
should be 192..... or 10.....
in wlan0??? there it's said 192.168.2.7, but can't enter there neither
okay then navigate to 192.168.2.1
that was it :)   I forgot to study that part :P
in windows, how to do something like that ifconfig?
i enter the router and there I saw "active DHCP clients": only my two computers IP there. So, guess no one is in here. Do you know why then "megaupload" detects my ip as downloading something?
are the two ips that are there your MAC addresses?
im not sure what is MAC address, but the two IP there are mine and my father's laptop
okay then your good i have no idea what megaupload is so can't help you there. You may want to contact their supoprt
ok. It's just a website from where you download things, with a limit if you are not premium user (as me). Thanks then!
